main.name: Milo Thiesen
main.occupation: Expert media manager & developer specializing in workflow automation and data driven low-code integrations
main.bio: Hey there! I'm Milo (they/them). Currently, I am the Creative Media Traffic Manager on the Marketing Team at Airbnb. For 15 years I have specialized in media archiving and digital asset management for photography, video, interactives, and animation. I've held positions in Digital Asset Management at Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, the American Museum of Natural History and the University of Massachusetts Amherst. I really enjoy knowledge sharing and occasionally I guest lecture at Pratt Institute, New York University, and the Metropolitan New York Library Council.

work.title: Creative Media Traffic Manager
work.description: Oversee photography deliverables for broadcast advertising campaigns, define and maintain metadata requirements & file format specifications, manage all traffic related communications between producers and the creative marketing teams. Responsible for creation and maintainence of low code integrations between machine learning taxonomies and marketing tools related to rights & property clearances. Develop custom interfaces based on various datasources including Airtable and Apache Superset. Completed the successful delivery, cataloging, classification, and documentation of all related automated processes of over 1.5 million images in less than six months.

work.company: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
work.title: Senior Media Asset Manager
work.description: Implemented Orange Logic DAM in less than one year. Migration of archival database InMagic Presto to ArchivesSpace. Evaluation of over 100TB of data including the 40 year broadcast history of Live From Lincoln Center. Integration between Monday.com, ArtsVision, and the DAM using Workato and Pipedream.com

work.title: Senior Technical Analyst - Digital Asset Management
work.description: Product owner and technical lead for the museumâ€™s enterprise digital asset management (DAM) system, NetX (1.7 million assets, 10 servers, 2,000 users).

work.company: The American Museum of Natural History
work.title: Media Archivist
work.description: Archived and documented complex media interactives. Archived and migrated data from a large number of external hard drives into a departmental DAM for video producers working on the award winning series, Shelf Life. Worked with the research library to develop EAD records and metadata crosswalks for complex scientific data across science divisions.

education.degree: Bachelor's of Fine Art, Photography & Video Installation
education.description: Focused on digital & analog photography, studio lighting, and print processes. Strong focus in media management.
